alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 9:36AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 8 to 14 inches possible up at Mt Ashland and Lake of the Woods. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, especially over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes Siskiyou Summit on I-5, Lake of the Woods on highway 140 and Dead Indian Memorial Highway. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of one half to one inch per hour are possible Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
